articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Mongolian Delegation
articles.content:
Ancient Tombs Found in Northern Part of Korea
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Archeologists of the DPRK have recently unearthed a group of tombs dating back to the Palhae Kingdom (698-926) in Korea's history. The tombs are located in the area of Kungsim-dong, Hoeryong City, North Hamgyong Province.
					 In this regard, KCNA met with Cha Tal Man, chief of an excavation party of the Academy of Social Sciences.
					
					 Cha said:
					
					 The group, about 300 meters long and 600 meters wide, consists mainly of earthen tombs with stone chambers dating back to Palhae Kingdom. There are also stone graves.
					
					 Found in those elliptical or rectangular tombs were scores of relics such as bronze ring, bead, brass bowl, cylindrical jar, plate and other earthenware, believed to be used by the Palhae people.
					
					 The Kungsim group of tombs is of weighty significance in study of the history and culture of Palhae Kingdom which succeeded to Koguryo Kingdom (B.C. 277-A.D. 668).
					
					 The unearthing work for the ancient tombs is going on now.

articles.title: DPRK Vice-Premier Meets Mongolian Delegation
articles.content:
DPRK Vice-Premier Meets Mongolian Delegation
Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Vice-Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Kang Sok Ju met and had a conversation with the Mongolian government economic trade delegation headed by Khaltmaa Battulga, minister of Industry and Agriculture, which paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday.

articles.title: DPRK, Mongolia Governments Sign Protocol
articles.content:
DPRK, Mongolia Governments Sign Protocol
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- The 9th meeting of the economic, trade, scientific and technological consultative committee between the governments of the DPRK and Mongolia took place at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Tuesday and Wednesday.
					 Present there were the DPRK government economic trade delegation led by Minister of Foreign Trade Ri Ryong Nam who is chairman of the DPRK-side economic, trade, scientific and technological consultative committee between the governments of the DPRK and Mongolia, the Mongolian government economic trade delegation headed by Khaltmaa Battulga, minister of Industry and Agriculture who is chairman of the Mongolian-side economic, trade, scientific and technological consultative committee between the governments of the DPRK and Mongolia, and Mongolian Ambassador to the DPRK Manibadrakh Ganbold.
					
					 The meeting reviewed the implementation of the protocol of the 8th meeting and discussed on bilateral cooperation issues in different fields.
					
					 A protocol of the 9th meeting was signed.
					
					 Ri Ryong Nam and Khaltmaa Battulga inked the protocol.

articles.title: DPRK FM Meets New Kazakh Ambassador
articles.content:
DPRK FM Meets New Kazakh Ambassador
Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Wednesday met and had a talk with new Kazakh Ambassador to the DPRK Nurlan Yermekbayev who paid a courtesy call on him.

articles.title: DPRK Ambassador to Brazil Appointed
articles.content:
DPRK Ambassador to Brazil Appointed
Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Thae Jong was appointed as DPRK ambassador to Brazil, according to a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK.

articles.title: DPRK Ambassador to Senegal Appointed
articles.content:
DPRK Ambassador to Senegal Appointed
Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Hong Son Phyo was appointed as DPRK ambassador to Senegal, according to a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK.

articles.title: Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from New Kazakh Ambassador
articles.content:
Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from New Kazakh Ambassador
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from new Kazakh Ambassador to the DPRK Nurlan Yermekbayev at the Mansudae Assembly Hall  Wednesday.
					 After receiving the credentials, Kim had a talk with the ambassador.

articles.title: Greetings to Australian FM
articles.content:
Greetings to Australian FM
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Julie Isabel Bishop upon her appointment as foreign minister of Australia.
					 Expressing the belief that the bilateral friendly and cooperative relations would contribute to the regional peace, stability and prosperity, the message wished her great success in her new job.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Mongolian Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Mongolian Delegation
Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a gift from the Mongolian government economic trade delegation staying here.
					 The gift was handed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, on Wednesday by Minister of Industry and Agriculture Khaltmaa Battulga, head of the delegation.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from King of Morocco
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from King of Morocco
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, received a message of greetings from Mohamed 6, king of Morocco, on Aug. 31 on the occasion of the anniversary of the DPRK. 
					 The Moroccan king said in the message that he was pleased to extend greetings to Kim Jong Un and sincerely wish the Korean people steady progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Algeria
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Algeria
Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, received a message of greeting from Abdelaziz Bouteflika, president  of the Algerian Democratic and People's Republic on Sept. 18.
					The president in the message extended warm congratulations to Kim Jong Un on the 65th anniversary of the DPRK on behalf of the Algerian people and government and on his own behalf. He said that he was pleased to heartily wish Kim Jong Un happiness in good health and friendly Korean people progress and prosperity.
					
					The president reiterated his will to boost the bilateral relation of friendship and cooperation in the interests of the two peoples.
					
					The president paid high regards to Kim Jong Un in the message, extending congratulations to him once again.

articles.title: Mongolian Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Mongolian Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- A Mongolian government economic trade delegation headed by Khaltmaa Battulga, minister of Industry and Agriculture, visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They went round historic relics preserved with good care at the old home in Mangyongdae, being briefed on the fact that the President  was born in the low thatch-roofed house and spent his childhood there, nurturing his great intention to liberate the country. 
					
					 The head of the delegation said that he deems it an honor to visit Mangyongdae.
					
					 He went on: Mangyongdae is the time-honored place. I got deep impressions to hear the stories about the members of the Mangyongdae family.
					
					 The delegation also went to the Pyongyang Essential Foodstuff Factory and the Pyongyang Cosmetics Factory.

articles.title: WCC Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
WCC Delegation Leaves
Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the World Council of Churches (WCC) led by General Secretary Olav Fykse Tveit left here on Wednesday.

articles.title: DPRK Soccer Team Beats Its Myanmar Rival
articles.content:
DPRK Soccer Team Beats Its Myanmar Rival
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- The league matches of Group I for the 2014 Asian U-16 Soccer Championship began in Wuhan of China on Wednesday. 
					 43 teams will play league matches, divided into 10 groups. The ten teams coming first in each group and five teams with highest points among those placed second will play matches in the championship. 
					
					 The DPRK, China, Myanmar and North Mariana Islands belong to Group I. 
					
					 The DPRK team beat the Myanmar rival 3:0 in its first match on Wednesday. 
					
					 The DPRK team will play match with the North Mariana Islands team on Friday.

articles.title: "Complete Collection of Kim Jong Il's Works" Vol. 4 Off Press
articles.content:
"Complete Collection of Kim Jong Il's Works" Vol. 4 Off Press
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House brought out "Complete Collection of Kim Jong Il's Works" Vol. 4, a library of the immortal Juche idea and the Songun idea, which contains his famous works.
					 The book contains 105 works including historic speeches, concluding speeches and talks made by leader Kim Jong Il from January to July, Juche 51 (1962).
					
					 The works deal with the ideas and theories of the education in the revolutionary traditions, the party work, socialist economic construction, military affairs, national reunification and the cause of global independence expounded by him through his energetic ideological and theoretical activities.
					
					 In "Revolutionary Traditions of the Party Are Established by the Leader of the Working Class" and "Education in Revolutionary Relics Should Be Conducted Well" and other works he indicates the tasks and ways for firmly defending and glorifying the revolutionary traditions of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					
					 "Let's Deeply Grasp the Great Chongsan-ri Spirit and Chongsan-ri Method" and "On Correctly Understanding the Validity of the Basic Line of Building Socialist Economy" and other works indicate the tasks to further develop the economy of the DPRK which turned into a socialist industrial state with the foundation of the independent national economy under the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 In "People's Army Is the Army of the Leader and the Party", "Worker-Peasant Red Guards Are the Powerful Civilian Armed Forces of Our Party", "U.S. Imperialists' Moves for Aggression and War Are Becoming More Vicious and Craftier" and other works he said that the basic mission of the People's Army is to firmly guarantee the revolutionary cause of the leader and the cause of the party with arms.
					
					 The book also contains works which deal with the issue of understanding the validity and vitality of the theoretical issues of political economy in reality and ideas and theories of establishing a revolutionary habit of study among university students, developing science and technology and training school youth and children to be revolutionary talents equipped with knowledge, a good moral character and good health.

articles.title: "Ode to the Motherland" Widely Disseminated in DPRK
articles.content:
"Ode to the Motherland" Widely Disseminated in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- "Ode to the Motherland", masterpiece song in the era of Songun, is resounding forth in the general advance for the final victory in building a thriving nation.
					 People are calling the song a treasure of Juche-based music and the most famous song to be conveyed down through generations.
					
					 Officials and other people across the country are actively learning the song, saying the ode created in the new century of the Juche era represents the greatest honor of the people living in Kim Jong Un's era.
					
					 Employees of ministries and national institutions including the Ministry of Metallurgical Industry, the Ministry of Agriculture, the Ministry of Light Industry, the Ministry of Railways and the Taesong Guidance Bureau say this song can be listed as national treasure, calling it a song presented to the people living in a great country.
					
					 Workers in steel, coal and power industrial bases and other sectors of the national economy are working miracles and innovations in production full of enthusiasm as they picture the bright future that will come true on this land along with the song "Ode to the Motherland".
					
					 Creators and artistes in the field of culture and arts are hardening their resolve to add luster to the ode truly reflective of the broad people's thinking and feelings towards the motherland and the big pride and self-esteem of the sun's nation together with the national anthem and create more pieces of monumental value conducive to education in Kim Jong Il's patriotism.

articles.title: Ancient Tombs Found in Northern Part of Korea
articles.content:
Ancient Tombs Found in Northern Part of Korea
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Archeologists of the DPRK have recently unearthed a group of tombs dating back to the Palhae Kingdom (698-926) in Korea's history. The tombs are located in the area of Kungsim-dong, Hoeryong City, North Hamgyong Province.
					 In this regard, KCNA met with Cha Tal Man, chief of an excavation party of the Academy of Social Sciences.
					
					 Cha said:
					
					 The group, about 300 meters long and 600 meters wide, consists mainly of earthen tombs with stone chambers dating back to Palhae Kingdom. There are also stone graves.

articles.title: Brisk Preparation for 11th National Korean Dress Exhibition
articles.content:
Brisk Preparation for 11th National Korean Dress Exhibition
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Preparations for the 11th National Korean Dress Exhibition are progressing apace in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 In this regard, KCNA had an interview with Sim Jun Chan, a section chief of the Garment Institute under the Ministry of Food and Consumer Goods Industries.
					
					 Question: What is the theme of the forthcoming exhibition?
					
					 Answer: The 11th National Korean Dress Exhibition will take place at the Central Youth Hall on October 2-4.
					
					 Its theme is "Korean-style dress associated with patriotism". In other word, the exhibition aims at upgrading the traditional dress and seasonal costumes in Korean style to meet the national characteristics and the aesthetic sense of the times and widely disseminating them among the people. 
					
					 Anyone is allowed to attend the exhibition, including teachers, researchers, creators, technicians, skilled workers, students and housewives who major in garment making.
					
					 The upcoming exhibition will focus on diversifying and modernizing clothing, and there will be a training course on garment designing and processing and a dissemination of books and multimedia on clothing technology during the exhibition. 
					
					 Diplomas, silk banners and cups will be awarded to successful units and individuals. 
					
					 Q: Would you tell me about ongoing preparations for the exhibition?
					
					 A: The Garment Institute is scrupulously working its preparations. 
					
					 District tailor's shops in the capital city of Pyongyang have striven to present quality garments with diverse styles, colors and patterns.  
					
					 The researchers of the Institute have concentrated efforts on the work to diversify color combination and vivify formation of patterns for the traditional Korean dress. Meanwhile the Institute planned to disseminate the technique for designing and processing men's clothes.

articles.title: Spectacular Successes Made in Implementation of WPK's Educational Policy
articles.content:
Spectacular Successes Made in Implementation of WPK's Educational Policy
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- One year has passed since the adoption of the ordinance on enforcing the universal compulsory 12-year education at the Sixth Session of the 12th Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK.
					 Great successes have been made during the past one year through the drive to successfully apply the idea of the Workers' Party of Korea on attaching importance to the rising generation and education.
					
					 At least 900 winners of university student research prize and many holders of certificates of invention and rationalization proposals were produced from among students.
					
					 Students of Kim Il Sung University and Kim Chaek University of Technology proved successful at the internet program contests.
					
					 Students Hong Chung Song and Pak Ji Hyon won gold medals at the 54th International Math Olympics and all other Korean participants also proved successful at it.
					
					 More than 1,100 students won the July 15 Honor Student Prize.
					
					 At least 9 300 teachers were honored with October 8 model professors and nearly 5,000 teachers with holder of new teaching method registration cards. They are discharging their mission in the work to bring up the pillars of the country.
					
					 Talented musicians are produced continuously at Kyongsang Kindergarten and students of Kumsong School proved successful at the 10th international festival "Moscow greets friends" held in Russia and other international art festivals.
					
					 Reliable sportspersons of the DPRK prove successful at the 27th World Universiad and other international games, glorifying the country with gold medals.
					
					 Youngsters are giving full play to beautiful traits of devotedly working for the party and the leader, the country and its people. 
					
					 More than 450 graduates from 18 universities of education and teacher training colleges from across the country volunteered to be teachers of schools in forefront islands and mountainous areas and went to difficult fields. A lot of graduates from senior secondary schools in Kangwon Province volunteered to the construction site of the Sepho tableland.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Accuses S. Korean Minister of Defense of Inciting Confrontation with DPRK
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Accuses S. Korean Minister of Defense of Inciting Confrontation with DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- South Korean puppet minister of Defense Kim Kwan Jin, a heinous war maniac, is letting loose a whole string of provocative remarks straining the situation on the Korean Peninsula.
					 Kim at a recent "briefing on defense policy" talked rubbish that the north "plans the 4th generation war aimed to foment social confusion in south Korea through cyber warfare, media warfare and terrorism, etc. in collusion with the forces following it." 
					
					 Not content with this rhetoric, he asserted that the "attempted rebellion" of the Unified Progressive Party could be viewed as a preparation for the war. He went the lengths of desperately slandering the measures taken by the DPRK for peace and dialogue as an "offensive for tactical dialogue."
					
					 Such reckless remarks made by Kim is nothing surprising as they were let loose by the guy steeped in enmity toward compatriots to the marrow of his bones.
					
					 However, they can never be overlooked as they adversely affect the inter-Korean relations and the atmosphere of detente on the peninsula.
					
					 Such provocative outpourings let loose by this confrontation maniac almost every day are aimed to chill the atmosphere of north-south dialogue and again escalate tensions in the region.
					
					 As far as Kim Kwan Jin is concerned, he held the post of defence minister during the previous regime and is staying in his office under the present one not for his military accomplishments but for his malignant tongue-lashings.
					
					 He made a false show of power, crying out for "retaliatory punishment" and "strike at base of provocation" after being appointed as minister of Defense under the Lee Myung Bak regime shortly after the occurrence of the Yonphyong Island shelling incident. 
					
					 He took the lead in suppressing progressive forces by spearheading such reckless actions as distributing "standard teaching program" and enforcing "education in the struggle against forces following the north" in the puppet army, something hardly imaginable even in the period of  the past military dictatorship.
					
					 He and other military gangsters worked out such a sinister and thrice-cursed scenario for making missile strikes at the monuments to the peerlessly great men in the DPRK, which even their American masters called a "foolish one." 
					
					 In late March he was so grateful to the new U.S. secretary of Defense for his first "phone call" that, behaving as if he were holding the same post, he blustered that he would "beat back the north's provocation even with all the forces in the U.S. involved," becoming a laughing stock of the world public.
					
					 He is no more than a confrontation maniac who does not know what a real war is like, bereft of any reason. However, whatever he uttered had an adverse bearing on the inter-Korean relations and the situation on the peninsula.
					
					 The crisis in the Kaesong Industrial Zone in April last was also caused by his reckless remarks.
					
					 Had the south Korean authorities not allowed him to stay in office, prudently paying heed to the warnings of the DPRK that his stay in office would bring disasters to the whole nation, there would have neither been such reckless remarks as calling for bringing the U.S. special forces into the KIZ under the pretext of "hostage rescue" operation nor would there have occurred the April crisis caused by it.
					
					 When there were good signs of improvement in the north-south relations including the resumption of operation in the KIZ, a fruition of the broad magnanimity and enormous efforts, unprecedented self-restraint and patience on the part of the DPRK, Kim Kwan Jin again went off hysteria like a mad dog.
					
					 An adage says a rabid dog makes all villagers uneasy. Due to the provocations of such confrontation elements as Kim Kwan Jin, the compatriots suffer a lot, to say nothing of the damage done to peninsula and the region.
					
					 It is necessary to eradicate such leftover of the confrontation era as trouble-maker Kim as early as possible in order to bring about fresh development of the inter-Korean relations and the peace and stability on the peninsula.
					
					 The DPRK will make every possible effort for the improvement of north-south relations including national reconciliation, unity, peace and prosperity but settle accounts with those traitors hurting its dignity and persist in provocations against it to the last.
					
					 Those who go against public mind-set will not be able to escape severe punishment by history.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime's False Propaganda against DPRK Flyed
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime's False Propaganda against DPRK Flayed
Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Papers Wednesday in commentaries accuse the south Korean regime of making much ado about the steps taken by the DPRK to postpone the reunion of separated families and their relatives.
					This is a crafty false propaganda to mislead public opinion in a bid to undermine the validity of the above-said steps and justify its crimes such as laying obstacles in the way of mending inter-Korean relations, Rodong Sinmun says, and goes on:
					
					The south Korean authorities are resorting to vicious moves for confrontation behind the scene of dialogue, beclouding the prospect for dialogue. It is self-evident that the DPRK cannot connive at them now that it has become as clear as noonday that they are seeking "confrontation accompanied with dialogue".
					
					This is the very reason that the DPRK could not but postpone the reunion of separated families and their relatives. However, the south Korean authorities and conservative media are spreading false rumors, an insult to the DPRK. It is a vicious move to evade the blame for the current grave situation and incite the atmosphere for confrontation with the DPRK under the pretext of the steps taken by it.
					
					The DPRK values the reunion of separated families and their relatives and the tour of Mt. Kumgang as they are all aimed to achieve national reconciliation and unity. Accordingly, it is useless to sacrifice one thing to gain the other thing. Such base method may work on the puppet regime unhesitatingly hurting the inter-Korean relations for its dishonest political purpose but it has nothing to do with the DPRK.
					
					Minju Joson says the south Korean conservative media inciting antagonism against fellow countrymen, going against the people's mind-set for national reconciliation, unity, independent reunification, peace and prosperity, will face only a stern judgment of the nation.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime's Anti-Reunification Crimes under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime's Anti-Reunification Crimes under Fire
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Koreans in China released statements on September 22 denouncing the anti-reunification crimes of the south Korean authorities.
					 The General Association of Koreans in China in its statement said that the recent resumption of dialogue and negotiations between the north and the south was the fruition of the unanimous desire and enthusiasm of all Koreans to bring back at any cost the era of "By our nation itself" when the trend of reconciliation, unity and cooperation of the nation grew strong and implement the north-south joint declarations.
					
					 Nevertheless, the south Korean authorities seriously hurt the dignity of the DPRK, dialogue partner, and made a mockery of it, advertising the resumption of dialogue and negotiations as a result of their "theory of principle," the statement noted, and continued:
					
					 This glaringly reveals their true colors as maniacs escalating confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					
					 The authorities are staging an alarming "witch-hunt campaign" in south Korea aimed at suppressing progressive democrats who call for the reconciliation, unity and reunification between the north and the south  by labeling them "pro-communists" and "forces following the north".
					
					  We are aware of what phase the south Korean authorities have reached in their inveterate hostility towards compatriots and whirlwind of confrontation sweeping south Korea.
					
					 It is nothing but hypocrisy and deception to talk about "confidence" with daggers hidden under their belts to hurt fellow countrymen.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should stop at once all acts of vitiating the atmosphere of dialogue and negotiations and release the unreasonably detained pro-reunification patriots.
					
					 If they persist in their anti-reunification acts to escalate the confrontation, they will not be able to escape the bitter rebuff and denunciation of all angry Koreans.
					
					 The Association of Korean Youth in China in its statement held that the smear campaign launched by the south Korean puppet conservative group against the DPRK is a shameless provocation to spoil the hard-won atmosphere of dialogue and negotiations between the north and the south and an unpardonable mockery and insult to the good will and magnanimity of the DPRK and the sincere efforts made by it to implement the north-south joint declarations.

articles.title: S. Korean Religious Body Accuses IS of Its Interference in Election
articles.content:
S. Korean Religious Body Accuses IS of Its Interference in Election
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Catholic Priests' Council for Justice in its declaration on the situation issued in Seoul on Sept. 23 condemned the puppet Intelligence Service (IS) for its interference in the election.
					 The organization accused the IS of conducting an organized influence-peddling operation during the election last year quite contrary to the people's mindset.
					
					 This brought to light the treacherous nature of the IS which perpetrated all sorts of illegal acts in violation of democracy, it noted, and continued:
					
					 The regime and the "Saenuri Party" deserve punishment for hamstringing the efforts of the people of different social standings to seek probe into the truth behind the illegal interference in the election and punishment of those involved in it and making a mockery of them.
					
					 It demanded the present chief executive make apology to the people for the above-said crimes.

articles.title: S. Korean Conservative Media Accused of Inciting Confrontation
articles.content:
S. Korean Conservative Media Accused of Inciting Confrontation
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- In order to put the north-south relations on a normal orbit, it is necessary to resolutely frustrate the reckless moves of the south Korean puppet conservative media as they are inciting confrontation with compatriots and bedeviling the inter-Korean relations, not knowing what media should do, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in an article.
					 Breeding plots and framing intrigues against reunification are the nature peculiar to the puppet conservative media and their inveterate evil practices, notes the article, and goes on:
					
					 Now the south Korean authorities are desperately accusing the DPRK of its just measure of postponing the reunion of separated families and their relatives till a normal atmosphere for dialogue and cooperation is created, far from admitting their responsibility and making an apology as regards the present inter-Korean relations which were derailed from their orbit. Taking advantage of the situation, the puppet conservative media, which worked overtly and covertly to check the progress of inter-Korean dialogue and cooperation being displeased with it, are devoting much space to articles inciting confrontation and abetting the deterioration of the north-south relations. Notably, a conservative medium groundlessly termed the north's above-said measure "the one aimed to maximize its negotiating ability" a few days ago.
					
					 As it is impossible to eclipse the sun with palm, no red herring can ever work in this bright world.
					
					 The puppet conservative media are stumbling blocks desperately quelling the desire of the south Korean people for independence, democracy and reunification.
					
					 The conservative media are, indeed, cancer-like entity and source of trouble blocking the improvement of inter-Korean relations and national reunification as they have been parasitic on fascist dictatorial forces, regarding confrontation with fellow countrymen as their principal work, far away from fairness and conscience as media. Unless their reckless trumpeting is snubbed, will it be impossible to defuse the distrust and enmity among Koreans. The situation clearly shows if the reptile conservative media are undeterred from going on the rampage, the just demand of south Koreans for independence, democracy and reunification will be violated and the inter-Korean relations will break down.

articles.title: DPRK's Anniversary Celebrated by Koreans in China
articles.content:
DPRK's Anniversary Celebrated by Koreans in China
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Koreans in China held celebrations marking the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 There took place a meeting of the Zhongnan Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China at the DPRK embassy in Beijing on September 8.
					
					 The participants laid a floral basket before the portraits of smiling Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them.
					
					 They went round photos dealing with the exploits the Generalissimos and Marshal Kim Jong Un performed for founding the DPRK and strengthening it.
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting.
					
					 The participants watched television airing a national meeting for celebrating the 65th anniversary of the DPRK held in Pyongyang.
					
					 The branches under the Yanbian Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China and the Yanbian Regional Youth Committee of the Association of Korean Youth in China held a meeting in Yanji City, Jilin Province, China on September 9.
					
					 At the meeting speakers praised the Generalissimos for founding the DPRK and building it into a socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence.
					
					 They said that Kim Jong Un is glorifying the national power and dignity of the DPRK before the whole world.
					
					 A letter to him was adopted at the meeting.
					
					 The participants watched a Korean film documenting his revolutionary activities.

articles.title: General Meeting of Italy-DPRK Association Held
articles.content:
General Meeting of Italy-DPRK Association Held
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- A general meeting of the Italy-DPRK Association for Friendship and Solidarity took place in Rome on Sept. 17. 
					 The general meeting reviewed the work of the association and discussed the future action program. 
					
					 The meeting elected the chief of the Rome Youth Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Songun Idea of Italy who is department director of a district committee of Rome Municipality of the Communist Party of Italy as the chief of the association.

articles.title: Foreign Organizations Introduce DPRK
articles.content:
Foreign Organizations Introduce DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Organizations of different countries and a regional body posted special write-ups on their websites on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The Russian Group for Solidarity with the DPRK posted articles titled "Anti-Japanese War", "Building of New Democratic Korea", "Fatherland Liberation War", "Post-war Rehabilitation and Construction and Socialist Construction", "Defending Socialism", "New Era of Building a Thriving Nation" and "65 Years of Victory and Glory" illustrated with the photos on the exploits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un from Sept. 2 to 9.
					
					 The Rostov Association for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism of Russia, the Moscow Workers' Union, Rostov-Na-Donu Anti-Bourgeois Front and the Anti-Globalization Movement of Russia, the Crimean Association for the Study of the Juche Idea of Ukraine, the Belarusian Association for Education and Science and the International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions posted articles titled "Guiding Idea of DPRK", "DPRK Today", etc. from Sept. 3 to 9.
					
					 The Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK posted an article titled "President Kim Il Sung's Nation-building Exploits" with his photo on Sept. 12.
					
					 The article praised him for setting forth the idea and theory of building the state centred on the popular masses for the first time in history and carrying them out to develop the DPRK into a socialist power--independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence.
					
					 The French Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Idea in an article on Sept. 6 introduced the victorious and glorious path of the DPRK.
					
					 Internet magazines including Mar 12, an internet paper and internet TV Krasnoe Televidenie of Russia and the Ukrainian internet paper Obektivnaya Gazeta carried articles and videos introducing the DPRK from Sept. 3 to 9.

articles.title: Foreigners Mark DPRK's Anniversary
articles.content:
Foreigners Mark DPRK's Anniversary
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- There took place receptions in Mongolia, Kuwait and Mexico and a friendly meeting, book and photo exhibition and film show in Thailand from Sept. 5 to 8 on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 Displayed in the venues of the events were photos documenting the exploits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and revolutionary activities of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Books including their works and pictures showing the Korean people working hard to build a thriving nation were on show.
					
					 Films shown included Korean films featuring the natural scenery of Mts. Paektu and Kuwol and Pyongyang.
					
					 A vice-chairman of the State Great Hural of Mongolia expressed his will to make efforts to boost the friendly relations between the two countries in several fields onto a higher level.
					
					 The president of the Federation of Peace and Friendship Organizations of Mongolia said with admiration that socialist Korea protected the sovereignty of the country and nation from the imperialists' arbitrary practices under the leadership of Kim Jong Un. It greatly contributes to ensuring the global peace and stability and establishing a fair international order, he added.
					
					 The representative of the Kuwaiti Foreign Ministry wished the Koreans further success in their efforts to build a thriving nation and ensure peace on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The general secretary of the Central Committee of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico and other speakers praised Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The chairman of the Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea of Thailand and the chairman of the Thailand-DPRK Friendship Association referred to Kim Il Sung's exploits in nation-building and the advantages of the socialist system in the DPRK where the people have become the master of the country.

articles.title: DPRK's Anniversary Marked in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
DPRK's Anniversary Marked in Foreign Countries
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Foreign newspapers carried special write-ups on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK. 
					 The September issue of the German newspaper Rote Fahne carried an article titled "65 years of victory and glory" together with the portrait of smiling President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 It said that since the proclamation of its foundation on Sept. 9, 1948 the DPRK has covered the way of victory and glory for 65 years and turned into an invincible socialist state. 
					
					 The paper elaborated on successes achieved by the DPRK in economic construction after the foundation. 
					
					 The Myanmar newspaper The New Age on Sept. 2 devoted two whole pages to the special write-ups with the photo of Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 It said in an article titled "DPRK today" that the DPRK with a long history of 5 000 years and excellent cultural tradition is opening the golden age of its development.
					
					 The DPRK is a country with strong sense of independence, it said, adding that the DPRK took strong counter-measures for self-defense against the U.S. and its allied forces when they persistently tried to stifle the DPRK over its successful launch of satellite Kwangmyongsong 3-2. 
					
					 The DPRK is directing great efforts to building a highly civilized socialist nation, the paper said. 
					
					 The Iranian paper Iran News on Sept. 8 carried an article titled "DPRK's 65 years of victory and glory" with photos of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Lauded Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Lauded Abroad
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Foreign newspapers carried articles to mark the 65th anniversary of the DPRK. 
					 The Zambian newspaper Zambia Daily Mail on Sept. 10 said in an article titled "Kim Il Sung, great leader of the 20th century":
					
					 President Kim Il Sung embarked upon the road of the struggle in his early years to save the destiny of the country and people. Exploring a new way of the Korean revolution he created the Juche idea, the idea of attaching importance to arms and achieved the historic cause of Korea's liberation under its banner. 
					
					 After the liberation he founded in the land of Korea the DPRK, the first people's democratic state in the East. 
					
					 In the Korean war ignited by the U.S. imperialists he defeated the U.S. which boasted of being "the strongest" in the world for the first time in history. After the war he built a socialist power independent in politics, self-sufficient in economy and self-reliant in defence. He was the prominent leader who victoriously led the cause of global independence, holding aloft the banner of independence against imperialism all his life. 
					
					 The September issue of the British paper Line of March said in an article titled "Historic holiday of the Korean people" that the DPRK stands tall as an impregnable fortress that challenges the imperialists' provocations and hostile policy and a state ensuring regional peace thanks to the leadership of President Kim Il Sung, General Secretary Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un. This greatly encourages the world people, it added.
					
					 The victory is in store for the Korean people as long as there are the revolutionary idea of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and the Workers' Party of Korea led by Kim Jong Un, the paper concluded. 
					
					 The newspaper of Democratic Congo L'Avenir on Sept. 10 carried an article titled "DPRK celebrates its 65th anniversary".

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recorre el Estadio Primero de Mayo y presenta tarea de reconstruirlo
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recorre el Estadio Primero de Mayo y presenta tarea de reconstruirlo
Pyongyang, 25 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, recorrio el Estadio Primero de Mayo y presento la tarea de reconstruirlo.
					Estuvo primero en la sala de presentacion del historial y la de conservacion de los objetos de interes historico-revolucionario.
					
					Dijo que en este estadio, inaugurado el primero de mayo de 1989 con la presencia de los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il, estan registradas las inmortales hazanas de ellos realizadas por el desarrollo del deporte nacional.
					
					Viendo con gran emocion las fotos del Presidente Kim Il Sung pronunciando el discurso de felicitacion en el acto inaugural del XIII Festival Mundial de la Juventud y los Estudiantes, y del Dirigente Kim Jong Il recorriendo el estadio, senalo que deben remodelarlo como estadio polivalente, digno de jactarse al mundo, para glorificar eternamente las hazanas de direccion de los Generalisimos.
					
					Paso revista a la graderia, la pista de atletismo, la cancha de futbol y otros puntos.
					
					Este estadio tiene gran capacidad, dijo y agrego que debe instalar nuevos asientos confortables y vistosos para transformar totalmente la graderia.
					
					Instruyo colocar las tablas de goma en la pista de atletismo y el cesped artificial en la cancha de futbol y poner las instalaciones de iluminacion nocturna para que se pueda auspiciar con exito cualquier juego.
					
					Recorrio tambien el campo de ejercicio bajo techo, la sala de descanso de los jugadores, la otra de espectadores y otros lugares.
					
					Destaco que el partido esta decidido a remodelar magnificamente el Estadio Primero de Mayo como simbolo de instalaciones deportivas del pais y estadio conveniente al aspecto de pais civilizado.
					
					Continuo que la reparacion del estadio es una obra importante para desarrollar mas el deporte nacional en medio de la creciente ola deportiva y para demostrar el poderio y el grado de civilizacion del pais, y presento las tareas y remedios detallados para cumplirla.
					
					Le acompanaron en esta ocasion el miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del CC del PTC y jefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC, Choe Ryong Hae, el miembro del Buro Politico del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del CDN, Jang Song Thaek, el miembro suplente del Buro Politico del CC del PTC y vicepremier, Ro Tu Chol, el jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Ri Yong Su, los subjefes de departamento del CC del PTC, Pak Thae Song y Ma Won Chun, el ministro de Deportes, Ri Jong Mu, y otros funcionarios.

articles.title: Tiene lugar IX reunion del comite RPDC-Mongolia
articles.content:
Tiene lugar IX reunion del comite RPDC-Mongolia
Pyongyang, 25 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar los dias 24 y 25 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae la IX reunion del comite consultivo intergubernamental RPDC-Mongolia sobre la economia, comercio, ciencia y tecnica.
					En la ocasion participaron la delegacion gubernamental economica y comercial de la RPDC presidida por el ministro de Comercio Exterior Ri Ryong Nam quien es presidente de la parte coreana de dicho comite y la misma delegacion de Mongolia encabezada por el ministro de Industria y Agricultura Khaltmaa Battulga quien es titular de la parte mongol del mismo comite, asi como el embajador mongol en Corea, Manibadrakh Ganbold.
					
					En la ocasion se balanceo el estado de ejecucion del protocolo de la VIII reunion del comite y se discutieron los problemas de cooperaciones bilaterales en varios dominios.
					
					Y quedo rubricado el protocolo de la IX reunion.
					
					Lo firmaron Ri Ryong Nam y Khaltmaa Battulga.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de nuevo embajador de Kazajstan
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de nuevo embajador de Kazajstan
Pyongyang, 25 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Nurlan Yermekbayev presento el dia 25 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae ante Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, sus cartas credenciales que le acreditan como nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la Republica de Kazajstan en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea. 
					Tras recibirlas, Kim departio con el diplomatico.

articles.title: Kang Sok Ju se reune con delegacion de Mongolia
articles.content:
Kang Sok Ju se reune con delegacion de Mongolia
Pyongyang, 25 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El vicepremier coreano Kang Sok Ju departio el dia 25 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con la delegacion economico-comercial gubernamental de Mongolia presidida por el ministro de Industria y Agricultura Khaltmaa Battulga, que le hizo una visita de cortesia.

articles.title: ACNC califica a Kim Kwan Jin de maniaco de confrontacion fratricida
articles.content:
ACNC califica a Kim Kwan Jin de maniaco de confrontacion fratricida
Pyongyang, 25 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El ministro de Defensa Nacional del Sur de Corea, Kim Kwan Jin, continua diciendo disparates provocativos que agravan la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana. 
					En la reciente "reunion informativa de la politica de defensa", dijo que "en confabulacion con las fuerzas seguidoras al Norte de Corea, este prepara la guerra de 4a generacion consistente en crear disturbio social mediante la guerra cibernetica, la campana mediatica y el terrorismo". 
					
					Insatisfecho con esto, cito como uno de los preparativos de esa guerra el "caso de conspiracion para una rebelion" por parte del Partido Progresista Unido y calumnio las medidas por la paz tomadas por la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea como una "ofensiva tactica de dialogo". 
					
					No sorprenden en nada esos disparates si se tiene en cuenta que el esta colmado de hostilidad a la parte connacional, pero no se puede tolerar su influencia negativa a las relaciones intercoreanas y al alivio de tension de la Peninsula Coreana. 
					
					Sus dichos provocativos persiguen el objetivo de romper el clima de dialogo Norte-Sur y agravar otra vez la situacion regional. 
					
					Como es conocido por todo el mundo, Kim repite el cargo de ministro de Defensa Nacional no por sus meritos militares sino con la chismografia anti-RPDC. 
					
					Al tomar la jefatura de esa cartera inmediatamente despues del incidente de fuego artillero de la isla Yonphyong durante el mandato de Lee Myung Bak, mostro la fanfarroneria de hablar de la "venganza" y "ataque al foco de provocacion". 
					
					Distribuyo a las filas del ejercito titere surcoreano el "programa de leccion estandar" e impartio la "educacion contra las fuerzas pro-Norte".
					
					Se puso al frente de la campana de represion a las fuerzas progresistas. 
					
					El plan de "ataque con misiles" a los monumentos de elogio a los Grandes Hombres de la RPDC, criticado como una "tonteria" hasta por sus amos norteamericanos, tambien fue inventado por Kwan Jin y otros gangsteres de la capa militar surcoreana. 
					
					A finales de marzo pasado, conmovido por la primera llamada telefonica de la nueva mandataria, dijo como si fuera secretario de Defensa norteamericano que en el caso de "provocacion del Norte de Corea", la "frustrara en un instante movilizando hasta las fuerzas armadas en el territorio norteamericano". 
					
					La crisis de la Zona Industrial de Kaesong de abril pasado tambien se debe a ese maniaco de confrontacion fratricida. 
					
					Ya hemos advertido que la repeticion de tal maniaco de guerra en su cargo causara desgracias a toda la nacion coreana. 
					
					Si las autoridades surcoreanas hubieran escuchado con seriedad esa advertencia y no lo hubieran amparado, no se habria escuchado los disparates de introducir los comandos norteamericanos en la Zona Industrial de Kaesong bajo el cartel de la operacion de "rescate de rehen" ni ocurrido la crisis de abril. 
					
					Al ver buenos indicios de la mejora de las relaciones intercoreanas incluso la reanudacion de la operacion de la Zona Industrial de Kaesong gracias a la magnanimidad y la paciencia de la RPDC, Kim vuelve a actuar como perro rabioso para echarlos a perder. 
					
					Para lograr nuevo desarrollo de las relaciones intercoreanas, la paz y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana, hay que eliminar cuanto antes las basuras de la era de confrontacion como el traidor Kim Kwan Jin. 
					
					Haremos todo lo posible por la reconciliacion y unidad nacionales, la paz, la prosperidad y la mejora de las relaciones intercoreanas, pero lucharemos hasta el final contra los traidores que insultan la dignidad de la RPDC.
					
					Los que nadan a contrapelo de la voluntad del pueblo seran sometidos a la severa sentencia de la historia.
